definition[0]: a unit for measuring liquids, equal to eight pints. In Britain this is 4.55 litres, and in the US it is 3.79 litres
example[1]: The car does about 50 miles per gallon.
definition[2]: a unit for measuring liquids, equal to 4.5435 litres
example[3]: A price increase of 2p on a litre of petrol is equal to a rise of more than 9p a gallon.
example[4]: a 12.6 million-gallon cargo of industrial oil
definition[3]: a unit for measuring liquids, equal to 3.785 litres
example[5]: The average price of unleaded gasoline has now risen to over $3 a gallon.
example[6]: An improvement in car mileage of just one mile per gallon would save 350,000 barrels of crude oil per day
